An **archeologist** is a [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") corresponding to the [archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") [role](/wiki/Role "Role").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [1.1 Equipment](#Equipment)
- [2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
- [3 References](#References)

## Generation

- *Main article: [Player monster#Generation](/wiki/Player_monster#Generation "Player monster")*

Like other player monsters, archeologists are never randomly generated and are thus rarely seen. [Students](/wiki/Student "Student") found on the [archaeologist quest](/wiki/Archaeologist_quest "Archaeologist quest") home level can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") to become archeologists.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Other archeologists are normally found on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), where they may appear among the hostile player monsters.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Most archeologists encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be [doppelgangers](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger"), which may temporarily assume their form; in either case, the game refers to them by the [rank](/wiki/Rank "Rank") title appropriate for the monster's level.

Reading a cursed [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") as an archeologist while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") will summon a number of archeologist monsters, although they won't have their usual equipment. Using [undead turning](/wiki/Undead_turning "Undead turning") on the corpse of a dead archeologist or using [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") on an archeologist statue will revive the corpse or statue as a player monster. In addition to [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") levels, archeologist corpses can be found in graveyards including those in the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead"),[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) and their statues may appear on [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island")[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) as well as in [cockatrice nests](/wiki/Cockatrice_nest "Cockatrice nest").

### Equipment

- *Main article: [Player monster#Equipment](/wiki/Player_monster#Equipment "Player monster")*

An archeologist on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") will carry either a [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip") (50%), a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") (25%) or a randomly chosen [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") weapon (25%). The [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon")'s [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") will be random between +4 and +8, and it will be either [erodeproof](/wiki/Erodeproof "Erodeproof") or [greased](/wiki/Greased "Greased") (but not both) with 33.3% probability each. There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") of the same type, if possible.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, archeologists will also be equipped with [1d3](/wiki/D_notation "D notation") random [offensive items](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), 1d3 random [defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item") and 1d3 random [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item"), as well as a randomly generated [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") containing [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail") and various other pieces of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") (as well as a [cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor"), some [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") and other items).

## UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), an archeologist corpse can sometimes be found under a boulder trap, and may be accompanied by the former adventurer's [fedora](/wiki/Fedora "Fedora") and [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip"); this is an homage to *Indiana Jones*.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 963](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/mondata.c#L963)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [create\_mplayers](/wiki/Source:Mplayer.c#create_mplayers "Source:Mplayer.c") in [mplayer.c](/wiki/Source:Mplayer.c "Source:Mplayer.c")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [dat/gehennom.des in NetHack 3.6.0, line 79](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/dat/gehennom.des#L79)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/sp\_lev.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1896](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/sp_lev.c#L1896): *the code is very cryptic but fortunately has comments*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [mk\_mplayer](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.6.1/mplayer.c#mk_mplayer "Source:NetHack 3.6.1/mplayer.c") in [mplayer.c](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.6.1/mplayer.c "Source:NetHack 3.6.1/mplayer.c") in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1")

Archeologist (player monster)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ archeologist
Difficulty 12
Attacks Weapon 1d6, weapon 1d6
@ archeologist
Difficulty 12
Attacks

Weapon 1d6, weapon 1d6

Base level 10
Base experience 221
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 1
Alignment 3 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No (unless player is an archeologist)
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

An archeologist:

  • can tunnel through walls.
  • needs a pick-axe to tunnel through walls.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 2718

An archeologist is a player monster corresponding to the archeologist role.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
    • 1.1 Equipment
  • 2 UnNetHack
  • 3 References

Generation

Main article: Player monster#Generation

Like other player monsters, archeologists are never randomly generated and are thus rarely seen. Students found on the archaeologist quest home level can grow up to become archeologists.[1] Other archeologists are normally found on the Astral Plane, where they may appear among the hostile player monsters.[2] Most archeologists encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be doppelgangers, which may temporarily assume their form; in either case, the game refers to them by the rank title appropriate for the monster's level.

Reading a cursed scroll of genocide as an archeologist while confused will summon a number of archeologist monsters, although they won't have their usual equipment. Using undead turning on the corpse of a dead archeologist or using stone to flesh on an archeologist statue will revive the corpse or statue as a player monster. In addition to bones levels, archeologist corpses can be found in graveyards including those in the Valley of the Dead,[3] and their statues may appear on Medusa's Island[4] as well as in cockatrice nests.

Equipment

Main article: Player monster#Equipment

An archeologist on the Astral Plane will carry either a bullwhip (50%), a long sword (25%) or a randomly chosen melee weapon (25%). The weapon's enchantment will be random between +4 and +8, and it will be either erodeproof or greased (but not both) with 33.3% probability each. There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an artifact of the same type, if possible.[5]

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, archeologists will also be equipped with 1d3 random offensive items, 1d3 random defensive items and 1d3 random miscellaneous items, as well as a randomly generated ascension kit containing dragon scale mail and various other pieces of armor (as well as a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor, some gold and other items).

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, an archeologist corpse can sometimes be found under a boulder trap, and may be accompanied by the former adventurer's fedora and bullwhip; this is an homage to Indiana Jones.

References

  1. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 963
  2. ↑ create_mplayers in mplayer.c
  3. ↑ dat/gehennom.des in NetHack 3.6.0, line 79
  4. ↑ src/sp_lev.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1896: the code is very cryptic but fortunately has comments
  5. ↑ mk_mplayer in mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.1

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.4. Information on this page may be out of date.

An '''archeologist''' is a [[player monster]] corresponding to the [[archeologist]] [[role]].

==Generation==
{{main|Player monster#Generation}}

Like other player monsters, archeologists are never randomly generated and are thus rarely seen. [[Student]]s found on the [[archaeologist quest]] home level can [[grow up]] to become archeologists.{{refsrc|src/mondata.c|963|version=NetHack 3.6.0}} Other archeologists are normally found on the [[Astral Plane]], where they may appear among the hostile player monsters.<ref>{{function|mplayer.c|create_mplayers|version=NetHack 3.6.0}}</ref> Most archeologists encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be [[doppelganger]]s, which may temporarily assume their form; in either case, the game refers to them by the [[rank]] title appropriate for the monster's level.

Reading a cursed [[scroll of genocide]] as an archeologist while [[confused]] will summon a number of archeologist monsters, although they won't have their usual equipment. Using [[undead turning]] on the corpse of a dead archeologist or using [[stone to flesh]] on an archeologist statue will revive the corpse or statue as a player monster. In addition to [[bones]] levels, archeologist corpses can be found in graveyards including those in the [[Valley of the Dead]],{{refsrc|dat/gehennom.des|79|version=NetHack 3.6.0}} and their statues may appear on [[Medusa's Island]]{{refsrc|src/sp_lev.c|1896|version=NetHack 3.6.0|comment= the code is very cryptic but fortunately has comments}} as well as in [[cockatrice nest]]s.

===Equipment===
{{main|Player monster#Equipment}}

An archeologist on the [[Astral Plane]] will carry either a [[bullwhip]] (50%), a [[long sword]] (25%) or a randomly chosen [[melee]] weapon (25%). The [[weapon]]'s [[enchantment]] will be random between +4 and +8, and it will be either [[erodeproof]] or [[greased]] (but not both) with 33.3% probability each. There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an [[artifact]] of the same type, if possible.{{reffunc|mplayer.c|mk_mplayer|version=NetHack 3.6.1}}

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, archeologists will also be equipped with [[d notation|1d3]] random [[offensive item]]s, 1d3 random [[defensive item]]s and 1d3 random [[miscellaneous item]]s, as well as a randomly generated [[ascension kit]] containing [[dragon scale mail]] and various other pieces of [[armor]] (as well as a [[cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor]], some [[gold]] and other items).

==UnNetHack==
In [[UnNetHack]], an archeologist corpse can sometimes be found under a boulder trap, and may be accompanied by the former adventurer's [[fedora]] and [[bullwhip]]; this is an homage to ''Indiana Jones''.
